analyzed: lus kyi yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa dang / dbang po ma tshang ba la sogs pa'i skyon spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because of having a perfect body, and because of abandoning faults such as incomplete faculties.

original: skal bzang gang zhes bya ba ni /ğŸ”½ngag kun nas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal bzang gang zhes bya ba ni / ngag kun nas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having good fortune.ğŸ”½This is because of being born into a good family, and because of being born into a good caste.

original: mtshan dang dpre byad rnams dang ldan //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpre byad rnams dang ldan // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having the major and minor marks.

original: bla ma'i mtshan nyid gtong ba la sogs pa rnams dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bla ma'i mtshan nyid gtong ba la sogs pa rnams dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because of being endowed with the characteristics of a guru, such as being generous.

original: yang na sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa nyid las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dpe byad rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa nyid las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir dpe byad rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Or else, he is endowed with the major marks because he is born from the very roots of virtue that have been accumulated.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with the minor marks because he is endowed with the faculties of faith, etc.

original: chags pa che la gcig tu dga' //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chags pa che la gcig tu dga' // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is devoted to the great passion,

original: theg pa chen po sngags kyi spyod pa rnam pa gsum la mos pa'i phyir dang / gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po sngags kyi spyod pa rnam pa gsum la mos pa'i phyir dang / gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that he is devoted to the three kinds of practice of the Great Vehicle, the Mantra Vehicle, because he is devoted to the great passion.

original: yul la phrag dog rnam par spangs //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul la phrag dog rnam par spangs // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He has abandoned envy with regard to objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la zhen pa dang bral ba'o //ğŸ”½dbang gsum pa sbyin pa'i gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la zhen pa dang bral ba'o // dbang gsum pa sbyin pa'i gnas skabs sam /
translated: This means that he is free from attachment to form, etc.

original: phyag rgya'i yul la zhen pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i yul la zhen pa spang ba'o //
translated: Or else, he has abandoned attachment to the object of the third consecration.

original: bag yod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bag yod ces bya ba ni /
translated: He is heedful.

original: dngos po bag tsam gyi phyir khro ba med pas bag med pa'i gnas skabs thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang / don yod grub pa'i rigs kyi dam tshig la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po bag tsam gyi phyir khro ba med pas bag med pa'i gnas skabs thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang / don yod grub pa'i rigs kyi dam tshig la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of anger even for the sake of a small thing, and because of the abandonment of all occasions of heedlessness, and because of the very observance of the pledge of the Amoghasiddhi clan.

original: rab tu dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du dga' ba phun sum tshogs pa'i lus ngag yid gsum dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du dga' ba phun sum tshogs pa'i lus ngag yid gsum dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The joyful is the possession of the body, speech, and mind endowed with the perfection of joy at all times.

analyzed: de rnams kyis bag med pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid bstan to // rnal 'byor ma yi snying po skyong // zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis shin tu rtse gcig pa nyid kyis dam tshig dang sdom pa 'dzin pa ni rnal 'byor ma'i snying po skyong ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: By these, the possession of the fruit of heedlessness is taught.ğŸ”½The protectors of the essence of the yoginis is the very protection of the essence of the yoginis by the observance of the pledges and vows through the natural state of extreme one-pointedness.

original: rdo rje theg pa gcig tu mos //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa gcig tu mos //
translated: The believers in the single vehicle of the Vajra is the very belief in the single vehicle of the Vajra through the natural state of extreme one-pointedness.

original: zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po sngags kyi yul la gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dad pa dang / yang dag par ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po sngags kyi yul la gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dad pa dang / yang dag par ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Thus, endowed with perfect faith means that he is irreversible from the domain of the Mahayana mantra.

original: theg pa dman la rgyab kyis phyogs //
analyzed: theg pa dman la rgyab kyis phyogs //
translated: He turns his back on the Hinayana.

analyzed: zhes @36b bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la lhag par mos pa med pa'o //

original: de la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i yon tan ldan //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon du gsungs pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, endowed with such qualities and so forth means that he is endowed with the qualities previously mentioned.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba dang / rgyud bshad pa dang / gdams ngag ston pa rnams so //
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba dang / rgyud bshad pa dang / gdams ngag ston pa rnams so //

analyzed: slob mas zhes bya ba ni rin po che lta bu'i gang zag la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: nus dang ldan zhes bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i don du gsol ba gdab par bya ba'o //

analyzed: de ltar bla ma'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni sngon du gsungs pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan pas so //ğŸ”½slob ma dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni sngon du gsungs pa'i yon tan dang yang dag par ldan pas so // slob ma dag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Having received the initiation, he should practice the observances.ğŸ”½Having practiced the observances, he should request the consecration of the body mandala.ğŸ”½Having received the consecration of the body mandala, he should request the consecration of the speech mandala.

original: ngag dang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur la sogs pa sbyin pa sngon du 'gro bas slob dpon dang gsang ba'i dbang dag gis so //
analyzed: ngag dang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur la sogs pa sbyin pa sngon du 'gro bas slob dpon dang gsang ba'i dbang dag gis so //
translated: Having received the consecration of the speech mandala, he should request the consecration of the mind mandala.

analyzed: rtogs dang zhes bya ba ni dbang gsum sbyin pas rang nyid kyis de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: ye shes ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i gdams ngag bstan pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i gdams ngag bstan pas thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Endowed with intuition means that, due to the teaching of the special instruction, one realizes nonconceptual intuition, preceded by listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: de ltar bla ma'i bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bla ma'i bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the teacher's duties,

original: da ni slob ma brtags pa'i sgo nas phan tshun brtag pa brjod pa'i phyir /

analyzed: ji ltar rin chen bdar ba dang // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Like testing gold by burning, cutting, and rubbing,ğŸ”½and like testing a gem by cutting,ğŸ”½so should you examine the mendicant who is well-endowed with virtue.

analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis so //

analyzed: gser zhes bya ba ni sa le sbram mo // bdar ba zhes bya ba ni ka shi la sogs pa'i bdar la'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du ni slob ma yang // lo ni bcu gnyis rab tu brtag //
translated: So should you examine the mendicant who is well-endowed with virtue means that the teacher should examine the student.

original: ces bya ba ni chen po'i ngo bor gyur pa /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chen po'i ngo bor gyur pa /
translated: For twelve years means that the student should be examined in terms of the nature of a great person.

analyzed: spyod pa dang / lta ba dang / lhag mar mos pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du ste /

original: brtags pas so //

analyzed: dus kun du zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs thams cad du'o //

analyzed: phan tshun brtag par byas nas da ni ma brtags pa'i skyon brjod pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gzhan du bgegs ni 'byung bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir dngos grub 'joms zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œit destroys power.â€

analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bgegs su gyur pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal ster zhes bya ba ni 'di dang pha rol du lus dang sems la sdug bsngal bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is said to â€œgive sufferingâ€ because it generates suffering in the body and mind in this life and the next.

analyzed: de ltar ma brtags pa'i skyon bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the faults of not examining,

analyzed: bcom pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni nus pa nyams pas ji ltar bcud len du 'gyur bas so //

analyzed: de'i phyir sngags kyis dag byed ces bya ba gsungs te /

original: bya khyung gi sngags kyis rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: bya khyung gi sngags kyis rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Purified by the mantra of Garuda,

original: dug gi bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bzhin slob ma dbang sogs kyis //

original: dag par 'gyur ba ni gtsang bar 'gyur ba ste /

translated: Because it has the nature of four hours.

original: shar nas zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shar nas zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Arising from the east means that it arises.

original: nam mkha' mchog las zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i dbus las so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mchog las zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i dbus las so //
translated: From the supreme space means from the center of the navel.

original: yang na 'khor ba thog ma med pa med pa nyid kyi 'jug pa la stong pa nyid kyi rten sems kyi rgyun gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'khor ba thog ma med pa med pa nyid kyi 'jug pa la stong pa nyid kyi rten sems kyi rgyun gyi stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Alternately, because of the power of the continuum of the mind, which is the support of emptiness, it arises in the beginningless and endless process of cyclic existence.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: â€œNatureâ€ means by its very essence.

original: rlung ni 'joms par byed ces bya ba ni rlung gzhan yongs su spangs nas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung ni 'joms par byed ces bya ba ni rlung gzhan yongs su spangs nas gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: â€œDestroys the windsâ€ means that it remains after abandoning the other winds.

original: yang na rlung gi de kho na nyid bsgoms pas rlung gzhan rnams 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rlung gi de kho na nyid bsgoms pas rlung gzhan rnams 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: Or, by meditating on the reality of the wind, it destroys the other winds.

original: dgu'i rnam par rgyu zhes bya ba ni de nyid lte ba nas 'byung ba'i srog ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: dgu'i rnam par rgyu zhes bya ba ni de nyid lte ba nas 'byung ba'i srog ni rlung ngo //
translated: â€œMoves in the nineâ€ means that the life-force wind that emerges from the navel has nine aspects.

original: dgu'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni phung po dang dbang po'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur te ;
analyzed: dgu'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni phung po dang dbang po'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur 'gyur te ;
translated: â€œIn the nineâ€ means that it has nine aspects by the division of aggregates and faculties,

original: khyab byed kyi rlung de nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab byed kyi rlung de nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the all-pervading wind is included within it.

original: rlung de zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rlung de zhes bya ba ni sngon du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: â€œThat windâ€ has the characteristics explained above.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rtsa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rtsa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The Dharma wheel is ninefold by the division of the nÄá¸Ä«s.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /ğŸ”½thun phyed dus nas brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / thun phyed dus nas brtsams nas ni //
translated: For that reason,ğŸ”½it is said, â€œBeginning from the half-period.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: bstan bcos las grags pa'i chu tshod bzhi'i mthar thug par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan bcos las grags pa'i chu tshod bzhi'i mthar thug par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The treatise [refers to] the four periods of time, which is the meaning of the word 'ending'.

original: 'jig rten pa la ltos nas thun ni dbyu gu brgyad kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la ltos nas thun ni dbyu gu brgyad kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: In relation to the world, a period is the duration of eight ghaá¹­ikÄs.

original: 'khor lo drug las zhes bya ba ni khyab byed kyi rlung spangs nas dgu dgu'i grangs kyi ngo bos nyin mo la 'khor lo drug la lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug las zhes bya ba ni khyab byed kyi rlung spangs nas dgu dgu'i grangs kyi ngo bos nyin mo la 'khor lo drug la lnga bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: From the six cakras, that is, from the nine [cakra]s, excluding the pervading wind, in the course of a day, there are fifty-four [winds] in the six cakras.

original: mtshan mo la yang de nyid de brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mo la yang de nyid de brgya rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the course of a night, there are also fifty-four, making one hundred and eight.

original: dgu bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni dgu dgu'i bdag nyid can ngo //
analyzed: dgu bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni dgu dgu'i bdag nyid can ngo //
translated: The ninefold nature means the ninefold nature of the [winds].

original: thun phyed kyi mtha' nyid du zhes bya ba ni dbyu gu bzhi'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: thun phyed kyi mtha' nyid du zhes bya ba ni dbyu gu bzhi'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: At the end of half a period means at the end of four ghaá¹­ikÄs.

original: rlung rnams kyang ni ldang bar byed //
analyzed: rlung rnams kyang ni ldang bar byed //
translated: The winds also arise.

original: ces bya ba ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs kyis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs kyis so //
translated: This is by the count of one hundred and eight.

original: de ltar gnas kyi ngo bo @50b bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas kyi ngo bo @50b bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the nature of the locations,

original: 'chad bzhin pa'i don gyis mtshams spyor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'chad bzhin pa'i don gyis mtshams spyor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to explain the junctions with the meaning that is being explained,ğŸ”½it is said:

original: de nyid gnas kyi dbye ba yis //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid gnas kyi dbye ba yis // zhes gsungs te /
translated: By the division of their locations,ğŸ”½They are the various conceptualizations.

original: de nyid ni sngon du gsungs pa'i brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid ni sngon du gsungs pa'i brgya rtsa brgyad kyi grangs rnams so //
translated: Those are the previously mentioned enumerations of one hundred and eight.

original: gnas kyi dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni yul rnams 'dzin pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnas kyi dbye ba yis zhes bya ba ni yul rnams 'dzin pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: By the division of their locations means by the characteristic of being directed toward the apprehension of objects.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rtog par 'gro zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma shes pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rtog par 'gro zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma shes pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: They are the various conceptualizations means that in the state of non-recognition,

original: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i grangs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i grangs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: they become the enumerations of afflictions by the nature of their own essence.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyi rang gi ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the essence of the three topics,

original: rang bzhin rnams kyi ming brjod pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½de dag ming rnams bshad par bya //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnams kyi ming brjod pa'i phyir / de dag ming rnams bshad par bya //
translated: now, in order to explain the names of the natures,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: it says, â€œTheir names will be explained.â€

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those means the conceptualizations.

original: phye nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi dbye bas rgyas par ro //
analyzed: phye nas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum gyi dbye bas rgyas par ro //
translated: Having differentiated means having expanded them by the division of the three topics.

original: ming rnams ni tha snyad du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ming rnams ni tha snyad du gyur pa ste /
translated: Names are conventions.

original: bshad par bya ba zhes dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba zhes dam bca' ba'o //
translated: The statement will be explained is the promise.

original: de ltar bshad par dam bca' ba bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bshad par dam bca' ba bshad nas /
translated: Having thus promised to explain,

original: rang gi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to state their nature,

original: 'dod chags zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhe sdang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, attachment, aversion, etc.

original: yul ma thos pa la yid la 'dun pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: yul ma thos pa la yid la 'dun pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the desire for an object that has not been heard.

original: byams pa med pa'i sems ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: byams pa med pa'i sems ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Aversion is the mind that is without love.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i da ngos po'i rang bzhin shes pa dang bral ba nyid kyi sems ni gti mug go //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i da ngos po'i rang bzhin shes pa dang bral ba nyid kyi sems ni gti mug go //
translated: Delusion is the mind that is devoid of the knowledge of the nature of things as they are.

original: rgyags pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems la yul mthong bas mtho ba'i ngo bo ni rgyags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems la yul mthong bas mtho ba'i ngo bo ni rgyags pa'o //
translated: Conceit is the mind's inflated nature due to seeing an object.

original: nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni rtog pa khyad par can ma thob pa la bdag gis thob po snyam pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni rtog pa khyad par can ma thob pa la bdag gis thob po snyam pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the thought that one has attained what has not been attained.

original: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i dngos po bdag gis ji ltar thob par 'gyur snyam du sems kyi rtog pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i dngos po bdag gis ji ltar thob par 'gyur snyam du sems kyi rtog pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Clinging is the thought that one should attain a superior thing.

original: phrag dog ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa mthong na sems la mi bzod pa nyid ngo //
analyzed: phrag dog ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa mthong na sems la mi bzod pa nyid ngo //
translated: Jealousy is the inability of the mind to bear the excellence of another.

original: khro ba zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba'i dbang gis sems la gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba'i dbang gis sems la gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'o //
translated: Anger is the transformation of the mind by the power of hatred.

original: ser sna zhes bya ba ni dngos po mi gtong ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: ser sna zhes bya ba ni dngos po mi gtong ba'i blo'o //
translated: Avarice is the mind's refusal to give up a possession.

original: g-yo dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi skyon sbed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi skyon sbed pa'o //
translated: Guile is the concealment of one's faults.

original: snyom las zhes bya ba ni sems kyis mi rig pa nyid brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos so //
analyzed: snyom las zhes bya ba ni sems kyis mi rig pa nyid brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos so //
translated: Laziness is the mind's lack of alertness, a quality that is adverse to vigor.

original: nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni sngon byas pa'i gnod pa nyams su myong bas sems gdung ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni sngon byas pa'i gnod pa nyams su myong bas sems gdung ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Fear is the mental anguish produced by the experience of former injuries.

original: @51a * // blo rgod pa zhes bya ba ni sems dmigs pa la spro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: @51a * // blo rgod pa zhes bya ba ni sems dmigs pa la spro ba med pa'o //
translated: Excitement is the mind's lack of delight in the meditative object.

original: brkam chags nyid dang ni zhes bya ba ni sems mkho ba'i yo byad la sogs pa la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: brkam chags nyid dang ni zhes bya ba ni sems mkho ba'i yo byad la sogs pa la zhen pa'o //
translated: Greed is the mind's attachment to necessities and other possessions.

original: gnyid ces bya ba ni gnyid do //
analyzed: gnyid ces bya ba ni gnyid do //
translated: Sleep is sleep.

original: the tshom zhes bya ba ni yid la som nyi za ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom zhes bya ba ni yid la som nyi za ba'o //
translated: Doubt is a mental state of uncertainty.

original: dar 'dzin dang zhes bya ba ni bag tsam rtogs pas sems la rgod pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dar 'dzin dang zhes bya ba ni bag tsam rtogs pas sems la rgod pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Conceit is a mental state of arrogance.

original: dga' dang zhes bya ba ni chags pa la sogs pa dang nye bar 'brel pa'i sems la chags pa'i khyad par ro //ğŸ”½chags bral zhes bya ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i dngos po mthong bas sems la dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dga' dang zhes bya ba ni chags pa la sogs pa dang nye bar 'brel pa'i sems la chags pa'i khyad par ro // chags bral zhes bya ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i dngos po mthong bas sems la dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: Delight is a mental state of attachment.ğŸ”½Aversion is a mental state of anger.

original: bregs pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: bregs pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Pride is a mental state of self-importance.

original: 'chab dang zhes bya ba ni sems la gnod pa mi brjod pa'i ngang tshul lo //ğŸ”½sred dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dngos po dang longs spyod la sogs pa la zhen pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'chab dang zhes bya ba ni sems la gnod pa mi brjod pa'i ngang tshul lo // sred dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi dngos po dang longs spyod la sogs pa la zhen pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Concealment is a mental state of hiding one's faults.ğŸ”½Craving is a mental state of attachment to one's possessions.

original: bag chags dang zhes bya ba ni sems la nyon mongs pa phra mos gos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang zhes bya ba ni sems la nyon mongs pa phra mos gos par byed pa'o //
translated: Habit is a mental state of being influenced by past actions.

original: sgyu dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan slu bar byed pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs can no //
analyzed: sgyu dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan slu bar byed pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs can no //
translated: Deception is a state of mind that deceives others.

original: rmongs dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi yul la the tshom dang sdug bsngal gyis khengs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmongs dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi yul la the tshom dang sdug bsngal gyis khengs pa nyid do //
translated: Confusion is a state of mind that is filled with doubt and suffering about special objects.

original: 'dod chen dang zhes bya ba ni longs spyod la sogs pa'i yul la reg par 'dod pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: 'dod chen dang zhes bya ba ni longs spyod la sogs pa'i yul la reg par 'dod pa'i blo'o //
translated: Great desire is a state of mind that desires to enjoy objects such as wealth.

original: rtsod dang zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtsod dang zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa'i dngos po la mkhas pa nyid do //
translated: Quarrel is a state of mind that is skilled in unpleasant things.

original: rtse 'jo zhes bya ba ni sems g-yo ba med pa nyid kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i lus ngag gi bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtse 'jo zhes bya ba ni sems g-yo ba med pa nyid kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i lus ngag gi bya ba'o //
translated: Play is a special bodily and verbal action that is not motivated by the mind.

original: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni yul la 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni yul la 'dun pa'o //
translated: Desire is the desire for objects.

original: reg dang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rgyal srid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas lus dang sems la khyad par du reg pa bskyed pa'o //ğŸ”½kun nas gdungs pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba mthong bas /
analyzed: reg dang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rgyal srid la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas lus dang sems la khyad par du reg pa bskyed pa'o //ğŸ”½kun nas gdungs pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba mthong bas /
translated: Touch is the production of a special touch in the body and mind by the conception of sovereignty over the mind and so on.ğŸ”½Burning is the burning of the body and mind by the conception of the desirable.

original: lus dang sems gdungs pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: lus dang sems gdungs pa'i bye brag go //
translated: It is a particular affliction of the body and mind.

original: rnam 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid mi dge ba la mngon par phyogs pas yid la 'dra ba'i skad cig ma'i bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid mi dge ba la mngon par phyogs pas yid la 'dra ba'i skad cig ma'i bskyed pa'o //
translated: Disquiet is the production of a mental continuum by the approach of the mind to what is unwholesome.

original: ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po nye bar ma bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhi ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po nye bar ma bsdams pa'o //
translated: Non-tranquility is the non-restraint of the senses.

original: rlom pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems la snyom las kyi khyad par gyis khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: rlom pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems la snyom las kyi khyad par gyis khyab pa nyid do //
translated: Self-satisfaction is the pervasion of the mind by a particular kind of laziness.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi rtog pa ma thob pa la bdag gis thob po snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gyi rtog pa ma thob pa la bdag gis thob po snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: False pride is the thought that one has attained what one has not attained.

original: 'gyod dang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bcas pa'i @51b dge ba la phyis 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod dang zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bcas pa'i @51b dge ba la phyis 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret is the remorse for what is wholesome that one has done.

original: khrel yod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ltos nas kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: khrel yod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ltos nas kha na ma tho ba rnams la 'jigs pa nyid do //
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of fear of what is objectionable in the eyes of others.

original: gus pa med dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la mi gus pa'o //
analyzed: gus pa med dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la mi gus pa'o //
translated: Lack of modesty is the lack of respect for wholesome actions.

original: yid ches med ces bya ba ni mtho ris dang thar pa'i yul la sems mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches med ces bya ba ni mtho ris dang thar pa'i yul la sems mi brten pa'o //
translated: Lack of faith means not to rely on the object of higher rebirth and liberation.

original: blo dman pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab la ma byang ba'o //
analyzed: blo dman pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab la ma byang ba'o //
translated: Low intelligence means not being skilled in wisdom.

original: ngo tsha med dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa sngon du song bas sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa sngon du song bas sems kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Shamelessness means the transformation of the mind due to desire.

original: brlan pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems bu dang chung ma la mnyes gshin pa'o //
analyzed: brlan pa nyid ces bya ba ni sems bu dang chung ma la mnyes gshin pa'o //
translated: Wetness means the mind being fond of children and wife.

original: ngo tsha shes dang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi yul la brten nas /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes dang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi yul la brten nas /
translated: Embarrassment means, based on one's own object,

original: 'jigs pa la 'jigs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la 'jigs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: being afraid of fear.

original: nyon mongs pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i nang du klog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa'i nang du klog pa'o //
translated: It is read within the afflictions due to being connected with the afflictions.

original: ngo tsha dang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las lhag pa'i gang zag mthong nas rang nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal lhod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo tsha dang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid las lhag pa'i gang zag mthong nas rang nyid la mngon pa'i nga rgyal lhod pa nyid do //
translated: Embarrassment means, upon seeing a person superior to oneself, loosening one's pride in oneself.

original: mi ster ba dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos la yang dag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi ster ba dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos la yang dag par spyod pa'o //
translated: Not giving means not practicing the Dharma that is contrary to compassion.

original: mya ngan zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan zhes bya ba ni mdza' bo dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa'o //
translated: Sorrow means the thought of being separated from loved ones.

original: yid gnyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i las la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: Doubt means turning one's back on virtuous actions.

original: rlom sems med ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i phan pa la bgrang ba las 'das pa la sems la zhen pa'o ;
analyzed: rlom sems med ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis byas pa'i phan pa la bgrang ba las 'das pa la sems la zhen pa'o ;
translated: No conceit means being attached to the mind that transcends the enumeration of benefits done by others.

original: / bsgribs dang zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'i dngos po la 'bad pa byed par rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: / bsgribs dang zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'i dngos po la 'bad pa byed par rtsom pa'o //
translated: Obstructed means beginning to strive for an unreal thing.

original: the tshom zhes bya ba ni yid kyis gnyis ka la reg pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom zhes bya ba ni yid kyis gnyis ka la reg pa'o //
translated: Hesitation means touching both with the mind.

original: ngal ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems kyis mi spro ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: ngal ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems kyis mi spro ba'i bye brag go //
translated: Fatigue means the distinction of discouragement in body and mind.

original: dbang dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: dbang dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: Powerless means being under the control of desire and so on.

original: 'khrul pa snying po stobs zhes bya ba ni gzhan la skur pa 'debs pa'i dgongs pas 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa snying po stobs zhes bya ba ni gzhan la skur pa 'debs pa'i dgongs pas 'khrul pa'o //
translated: â€œDelusion, the essence of powerâ€ means delusion by the intention of deprecating others.

original: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par sprad pa'i gnod pa la gzhan gyis de byas so snyam du mngon par rlom pa'o //
analyzed: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni ma brtags par sprad pa'i gnod pa la gzhan gyis de byas so snyam du mngon par rlom pa'o //
translated: â€œFearâ€ means the manifest conceit that â€œhe did thatâ€ to the harm of one who is given without examination.

original: brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dag gis las 'ga' zhig la yang nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: brgyal ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems dag gis las 'ga' zhig la yang nus pa med pa'o //
translated: â€œSwoonâ€ means the inability of body and mind to do anything at all.

original: thim pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems la dmigs las 'og rgyu ba'i ngang tshul nyid do //
analyzed: thim pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems la dmigs las 'og rgyu ba'i ngang tshul nyid do //
translated: â€œDissolutionâ€ means the nature of the mind that is engaged in the lower realms.

original: 'khrugs pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes spangs pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid do //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying rjes spangs pa'i sems kyi rgyun nyid do //
translated: â€œAgitationâ€ means the continuity of the mind that is abandoned by compassion.

original: gya gyu zhes bya ba ni sems kyi chos rnams gzhan la mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: gya gyu zhes bya ba ni sems kyi chos rnams gzhan la mi ston pa'o //
translated: â€œCunningâ€ means not showing the mental phenomena to others.

original: smin dang zhes bya ba ni @52a * //
analyzed: smin dang zhes bya ba ni @52a * //
translated: â€œRipeningâ€ means

original: las byas pa la yang ma byas pas phyogs pas lus dang dang ngag gi rnam par rig pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: las byas pa la yang ma byas pas phyogs pas lus dang dang ngag gi rnam par rig pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: the engagement in the awareness of body and speech by the side of the non-doing of the done action.

original: rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i dngos po mi brjed pas so //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa zhes bya ba ni sngar nyams su myong ba'i dngos po mi brjed pas so //
translated: Recollection is the non-forgetting of an experienced object.

original: rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dag la phyis mi byed pa'i dus yang de lta bu'i rgyun no //
analyzed: rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du byas pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dag la phyis mi byed pa'i dus yang de lta bu'i rgyun no //
translated: Non-revealing form is the continuity of a virtuous or non-virtuous action that was initially performed, even after the time when it is no longer being performed.

original: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni sems la rtse gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa zhes bya ba ni sems la rtse gcig pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Carelessness is the lack of one-pointedness of mind.

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni sngon du byas pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis de dang de'i rnam pa sad par rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba ni sngon du byas pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis de dang de'i rnam pa sad par rung ba nyid do //
translated: Negative reflex actions are the latent potentialities that are the power to awaken to that and that aspect through the force of what was previously done.

original: nyam chung zhing zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mang ba la sogs pas dge ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la mi spro ba'o //
analyzed: nyam chung zhing zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mang ba la sogs pas dge ba la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams la mi spro ba'o //
translated: Weakness is the lack of enthusiasm for virtuous actions, etc., due to having many afflictions, etc.

original: yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni sems sdug bsngal gyis 'khrugs pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni sems sdug bsngal gyis 'khrugs pa nyid do //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is the disturbance of the mind by suffering.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rags pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rags pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the tendency toward coarse discrimination.

original: skrag dang zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa'i dngos po mthong nas de la sems rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: skrag dang zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa'i dngos po mthong nas de la sems rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid do //
translated: Fear is the turning away of the mind from an object that is seen to be fearful.

original: rmugs dang zhes bya ba ni las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rmugs dang zhes bya ba ni las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: Drowsiness is the unfitness of the mind.

original: gnyid dang zhes bya ba ni snyom las kyis yongs su khyab pa nyid la gnyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: gnyid dang zhes bya ba ni snyom las kyis yongs su khyab pa nyid la gnyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i dngos po nyid do //
translated: Sleep is the complete pervasion of the mind by laziness, and the state of being directed toward sleep.

original: brkam chags zhes bya ba ni yo byad la sogs pa yongs su mi gtong ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: brkam chags zhes bya ba ni yo byad la sogs pa yongs su mi gtong ba'i blo'o //
translated: Greed is the mind's unwillingness to give up possessions, etc.

original: rtse ba zhes bya ba yid g-yeng ba sngon du 'gro ba can lus dang ngag gi bya ba rtse ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rtse ba zhes bya ba yid g-yeng ba sngon du 'gro ba can lus dang ngag gi bya ba rtse ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Play is the activity of body and speech preceded by distraction.

original: khrung khrung dang zhes bya ba ni sems la bskum pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: khrung khrung dang zhes bya ba ni sems la bskum pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Dancing is the state of the mind being bent on that.

original: 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni srog chags rnams gsad pa la sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba zhes bya ba ni srog chags rnams gsad pa la sems pa'o //
translated: Violence is the intention to kill living beings.

original: le lo zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang lhan cig spyod pa'o //
analyzed: le lo zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang lhan cig spyod pa'o //
translated: Laziness is the mind's association with the opposite of vigor.

original: g-yan pa nyid ces bya ba ni nad kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: g-yan pa nyid ces bya ba ni nad kyi bye brag go //
translated: Itching is a particular kind of disease.

original: bsam dang zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i dngos po'i yul la bsam pas mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam dang zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i dngos po'i yul la bsam pas mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: Thinking is the mental activity of directing the mind to a particular object.

original: dpyod dang zhes bya ba ni blos rnam par dbye bar bzod pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod dang zhes bya ba ni blos rnam par dbye bar bzod pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the mental activity of distinguishing an object by the intellect.

original: zhum pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gnod pa lan mang du byas pa la slar gnod pa ma grub pas de mthong bas sems la mi spro ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhum pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gnod pa lan mang du byas pa la slar gnod pa ma grub pas de mthong bas sems la mi spro ba'i rnam pa'o //

original: kun rdzob de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gis byas pa'i sdig pa ngo tsha ba'i dbang gis gzhan la sbed pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gis byas pa'i sdig pa ngo tsha ba'i dbang gis gzhan la sbed pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the mental activity of hiding oneâ€™s own faults out of shame.

original: don yod dang zhes bya ba ni las byas pa la 'bras bu dang bcas par rlom pa'o //
analyzed: don yod dang zhes bya ba ni las byas pa la 'bras bu dang bcas par rlom pa'o //

analyzed: ster la dga' zhes bya ba ni @52b longs spyod chung ba nyid kyis lus dang sems bde bar mi gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Desire for giving is the mental activity of not being able to remain in a state of physical and mental ease because of having few possessions.

original: dga' ba gcig pu 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bde ba la 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba gcig pu 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid bde ba la 'dun pa'o //
translated: Desire for pleasure is the mental activity of being intent on oneâ€™s own happiness.

original: 'jigs dang zhes bya ba ni nyams su ma myong ba'i dngos po mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'jigs dang zhes bya ba ni nyams su ma myong ba'i dngos po mthong bas so //
translated: Fear means seeing things that one has not experienced.

original: 'dar dang zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa rkyen gyi stobs kyis lus 'dar ba'o //
analyzed: 'dar dang zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa rkyen gyi stobs kyis lus 'dar ba'o //
translated: Trembling means the body trembling due to the power of conditions that produce fear.

original: phra bdag nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu chung ba nyid do //
analyzed: phra bdag nyid ces bya ba ni shin tu chung ba nyid do //

original: gsal dang zhes bya ba ni sems yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: gsal dang zhes bya ba ni sems yang ba nyid do //

original: rnam gsal zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi chos rnams gzhan la ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gsal zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi chos rnams gzhan la ston pa'o //

original: lhung 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sbyang ba nyid kyis gzhan la dgongs nas tshig gzhan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: lhung 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sbyang ba nyid kyis gzhan la dgongs nas tshig gzhan brjod pa'o //

original: ma 'brel dang zhes bya ba ni ci yang rung ba smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma 'brel dang zhes bya ba ni ci yang rung ba smra ba nyid do //

original: rtag pa'i de nyid dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs kyi lta bas mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i de nyid dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs kyi lta bas mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The reality of permanence means being attached to the view of the transitory collection.

original: dka' ba'i khur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa che ba nyid do //
analyzed: dka' ba'i khur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa che ba nyid do //
translated: Difficult burden means having great desires.

original: ngoms med ces bya ba ni yang dang yang du yul la 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: ngoms med ces bya ba ni yang dang yang du yul la 'dun pa'o //
translated: Insatiable means repeatedly longing for objects.

original: gnod pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gnod pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: Harm is the intention to inflict harm on others.

original: mi gsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba chung ba la yang mngon du gyur pa med pa nyid do //

original: yid du 'ong zhes bya ba ni longs spyod che ba nyid kyis dma' ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid du 'ong zhes bya ba ni longs spyod che ba nyid kyis dma' ba med pa nyid do //

original: gnas med ces bya ba ni sems g-yo ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas med ces bya ba ni sems g-yo ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Unstable is the mind that is unsteady.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu ma thob pa'i longs spyod thob par 'dod pa'o //ğŸ”½ngo mtshar skyes bu nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu ma thob pa'i longs spyod thob par 'dod pa'o // ngo mtshar skyes bu nyid dang ni //

original: zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa nyid kyis nga rgyal dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa nyid kyis nga rgyal dang bcas pa nyid do //

original: ya mtshan zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i gtam thos pas 'di ni ci zhig yin snyam du ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ya mtshan zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i gtam thos pas 'di ni ci zhig yin snyam du ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //

original: chog ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i dngos po mthong bas yid dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chog ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i dngos po mthong bas yid dga' ba'o //

original: skye bo ngan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo dam pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo dam pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The term â€œevil personâ€ is a synonym for â€œnon-saint.â€

original: dman pa'i de nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar gnas pa'i ngo bo mi shes pa'i phyin ci log go //
analyzed: dman pa'i de nyid ces bya ba ni ji ltar gnas pa'i ngo bo mi shes pa'i phyin ci log go //
translated: The term â€œinferior realityâ€ is a synonym for â€œerror,â€ i.e., the non-understanding of the nature of things as they are.

original: sdug bsngal gsum zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi dbye bas so //
translated: The term â€œthree sufferingsâ€ is a synonym for the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: yang na las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: yang na las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Alternatively, the three sufferings are the suffering of karma, the suffering of the passions, and the suffering of birth.

original: srid pa la ni chags pa dang // zhes bya ba ni khams gsum na gnas pa la sred pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa la ni chags pa dang // zhes bya ba ni khams gsum na gnas pa la sred pa'o //
translated: â€œAttachment to existenceâ€ is a synonym for craving for remaining in the three realms.

original: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pas gnas so //ğŸ”½rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus @53a * //
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pas gnas so // rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus @53a * //
translated: â€œTheseâ€ refers to the natural essential conceptualizations.

original: thams cad du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du'o //
translated: â€œAlwaysâ€ means at all times.

original: brgya dang brgyad lhag pa zhes bya ba ni brgya rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: brgya dang brgyad lhag pa zhes bya ba ni brgya rtsa brgyad do //
translated: â€œOne hundred and eightâ€ means one hundred and eight.

original: nyid dang mtshan mo zhes bya ba ni rlung bzhin du'o //
analyzed: nyid dang mtshan mo zhes bya ba ni rlung bzhin du'o //
translated: Day and night means like the wind.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni nges par ro //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni nges par ro //
translated: Certain means definitely.

original: rang bzhin rlung gi mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: rang bzhin rlung gi mtshan nyid yin //
translated: The nature is the characteristic of the wind.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i rlung gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the wind of conceptualization.

original: pandi ta aa langka ka la sha de bas mdzad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa zab mo'i don gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u gsum pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta aa langka ka la sha de bas mdzad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa zab mo'i don gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u gsum pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the extensive explanation of the third chapter of the glorious tantra of Vajramala, the great yoga tantra, called Clarifying the Profound Meaning, composed by the paá¹‡á¸ita AlankaraÅ›rÄ«.

original: // / de ltar le'u gsum pas rdo rje phreng ba'i yul la dri ba gsal bar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u gsum pas rdo rje phreng ba'i yul la dri ba gsal bar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having clarified the questions regarding the domain of the VajramÄlÄ in three chapters,

analyzed: da ni gsang ba 'dus pa'i yul la dri ba gsal ba brjod pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to state the clarifications of the questions regarding the domain of the GuhyasamÄja,

original: de'i dri ba'i lan gdab pa bshad par rtsom pa ni de nas rdo rje gsum nyi mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dri ba'i lan gdab pa bshad par rtsom pa ni de nas rdo rje gsum nyi mas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: composing the explanation of the answers to those questions, it is said Then, the sun of the three vajras... and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni le'u gsum pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni le'u gsum pa bshad pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: Then, after the explanation of the third chapter.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje gsum gyi nyi mas gsang ba 'dus pa'i don bshad ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje gsum gyi nyi mas gsang ba 'dus pa'i don bshad ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The Bhagavat, the Sun of the Three Vajras, explained the meaning of the Guhyasamaja.

original: rdo rje gsum ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni sku gsung thugs rdo rje ste /
translated: The Three Vajras are the vajras of body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnams kyi bsdu ba ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bsdu ba ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: Their collection is the Three Vajras.

original: de nyid ni rdo rje ste rdo rje gsum gyi nyi ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje ste rdo rje gsum gyi nyi ma'o //
translated: That itself is the vajra, the Sun of the Three Vajras.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad mun pa 'joms pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum gyi nyi ma ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad mun pa 'joms pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje gsum gyi nyi ma ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The Sun of the Three Vajras is Vajradhara, because he destroys the darkness of all adverse factors.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /ğŸ”½de'i phyir ; gsang snying padma kha 'byed pa //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / de'i phyir ; gsang snying padma kha 'byed pa //
translated: What is he like?ğŸ”½Therefore it is said:

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The opener of the lotus of the secret essence.

original: gsang ba ni sba bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni sba bar bya ba'o //
translated: The secret is to be concealed.

original: padma ni lha mo'i padma ste /
analyzed: padma ni lha mo'i padma ste /
translated: The lotus is the lotus of the goddess.

original: de rtogs par byed pa ni rab tu sad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa ni rab tu sad par byed pa ste /
translated: The one who causes it to open is the awakener.

original: rdo rje las spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje las spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he causes it to open with a mass of light rays emanating from the vajra.

original: ji ltar phyi rol du nyi ma shar bas mtsho skyes kha 'bye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol du nyi ma shar bas mtsho skyes kha 'bye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the lotus opens up when the sun rises in the external world,

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyis gsang ba'i chu skyes kha 'byed par 'gyur zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams kyis gsang ba'i chu skyes kha 'byed par 'gyur zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: so too should one understand that the secret lotus opens up when the sun-rays of the Lord rise.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the Guhyasamaja?ğŸ”½Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir de nyid mchog ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid mchog ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That itself is supreme,

original: mthar thug pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zung du 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the essence of the union of ultimate non-abiding nirvana.

original: rdo rje nyi ma ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the Vajrasun? Therefore, it is said:

original: bde ba chen po'i go 'phang bzhugs //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i go 'phang bzhugs //

translated: Without doubt means that the yogi who has perfected the stage of generation, who is constantly and always generating the pride of being the deity, will definitely attain the result of the divisions of the bindu in six months by the power of meditating on the reality of the vÄyu and mantra.

original: bcom ldan 'das spro pa'i sngags de srid du bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das spro pa'i sngags de srid du bzlas par bya ste /
translated: one should recite the mantra of the generation of Bhagavat as much as one can.

original: ji srid thod pa kha sbyor gyi nang na gnas pa'i ri lu du ba 'byung bar byed 'bar bar byed pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid thod pa kha sbyor gyi nang na gnas pa'i ri lu du ba 'byung bar byed 'bar bar byed pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite until the pill that is located inside the joined skull cups emits smoke and blazes with flames.

original: de nas ri lu'i dngos grub thob pas de khar bcug nas ji ltar 'dod pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni ri lu'i dngos grub rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: de nas ri lu'i dngos grub thob pas de khar bcug nas ji ltar 'dod pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni ri lu'i dngos grub rnam pa gcig go //
translated: Then, having attained the power of the pill, one should place it in the mouth and go from buddhafield to buddhafield as one wishes. This is one kind of power of the pill.

original: yang na dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: yang na dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Alternatively, following the glorious Guhyasamaja,

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa gsungs pa'i cho gas sngags nyid kyis ri lu'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa gsungs pa'i cho gas sngags nyid kyis ri lu'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: one should accomplish the power of the pill by means of the mantra itself through the rite taught in the twelfth chapter.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: aom yig ri lu bsgom byas pa //
analyzed: aom yig ri lu bsgom byas pa //
translated: Meditate on the syllable om

original: tsan ka yi snying po'i tshad //
analyzed: tsan ka yi snying po'i tshad //
translated: as the size of a mustard seed.

original: dbus su rang lha yi ni gzugs //ğŸ”½khar ni bsam zhing bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dbus su rang lha yi ni gzugs // khar ni bsam zhing bsgom par bya //
translated: In the center, the form of one's deity,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: one should imagine and meditate in the mouth.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: aom yig tsan ka'i snying po'i tshad tsam gyi ri lu bsgoms te /
analyzed: aom yig tsan ka'i snying po'i tshad tsam gyi ri lu bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on the syllable om as the size of a mustard seed.

original: dbus su zhes bya ba ni ri lu'i nang du'o //
analyzed: dbus su zhes bya ba ni ri lu'i nang du'o //
translated: In the center means inside the pill.

original: rang gi lha'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi bdag po'i gzugs su bsgoms te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi bdag po'i gzugs su bsgoms te /
translated: The form of one's deity means meditating on the form of the lord of the seed syllable.

original: khar zhes bya ba ni mgo bo'i sgor 'jug pa'i ngo bos rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: khar zhes bya ba ni mgo bo'i sgor 'jug pa'i ngo bos rnam par bsams te /
translated: The word kham is to be contemplated in the form of entering the door of the head.

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du goms par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du goms par bya'o //
translated: Meditate means to become familiar with it again and again.

original: gang zhig de ltar goms par byas pa de //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar goms par byas pa de //
translated: One who has become familiar in this way

original: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam pa'i 'od du 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam pa'i 'od du 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: becomes a bodhisattva with equal radiance.

original: ral gri zhes bya ba ni rang 'dod pa'i lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid bzang po'i @63a * //
analyzed: ral gri zhes bya ba ni rang 'dod pa'i lha'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid bzang po'i @63a * //
translated: The word sword means that, endowed with the pride of one's desired deity, one meditates on the external good characteristics of the sword

original: ral gri stong pa nyid du bsgoms la de'i rjes su kham yig yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i don yod grub pa phyag rgya dang bcas pa rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: ral gri stong pa nyid du bsgoms la de'i rjes su kham yig yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i don yod grub pa phyag rgya dang bcas pa rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: as emptiness, and after that, one meditates on Amoghasiddhi arisen from the transformation of the syllable kham, together with the consort.

original: de dang snyoms par zhugs pas zhu bar gyur pa las byung ba'i ral gri 'od zer rnam pa lnga 'phro ba bsgoms te /
analyzed: de dang snyoms par zhugs pas zhu bar gyur pa las byung ba'i ral gri 'od zer rnam pa lnga 'phro ba bsgoms te /
translated: By entering into union with her, one meditates on the sword arisen from the melting, radiating five-colored light rays.

original: de srid du rang 'dod pa'i lha'i sngags bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: de srid du rang 'dod pa'i lha'i sngags bzla bar bya ste /
translated: One should recite the mantra of one's desired deity for as long as that lasts.

original: ji srid du du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma nye bar mtshon pa sngon du 'gro bas 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: ji srid du du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma nye bar mtshon pa sngon du 'gro bas 'bar ba'o //
translated: As long as the signs of smoke and so forth are perceived, there is the blazing.

original: de'i rjes la lag tu gzung ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la lag tu gzung ste /
translated: After that, one should take it in one's hand.

original: yid la 'dod pa bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: yid la 'dod pa bsgrub par bya //
translated: One should accomplish what is desired in the mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni ral gri'i dngos grub po //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ral gri'i dngos grub po //
translated: This is the power of the sword.

original: ro langs dang zhes bya ba ni ro langs bslang ba'o //
analyzed: ro langs dang zhes bya ba ni ro langs bslang ba'o //
translated: The vetala is the raising of the vetala.

original: 'di yang rgya cher ni nges par brjod pa'i rgyud bla ma'i 'grel pa zab mo'i don yid bzhin nor bu zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu pa las rgya cher rnam par bshad pas /
analyzed: 'di yang rgya cher ni nges par brjod pa'i rgyud bla ma'i 'grel pa zab mo'i don yid bzhin nor bu zhes bya ba las le'u nyi shu pa las rgya cher rnam par bshad pas /
translated: This is also extensively explained in the twenty-first chapter of the commentary on the Sublime Tantra of the Vajra of Mind called the Wish-Fulfilling Gem of the Profound Meaning.

original: de nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it from there.

original: bye brag tu rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: bye brag tu rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: In particular, following the Great Yoga Tantra,

original: mi bskyod rdo rje'i nga rgyal byas te /
analyzed: mi bskyod rdo rje'i nga rgyal byas te /
translated: one should perform the pride of Akshobhya Vajra.

original: m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i sngags rnams kyis dgos pa bya'o //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i la sogs pa'i sngags rnams kyis dgos pa bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish the purpose with the mantras of Mamaki and so forth.

original: rgyal srid ces bya ba ni dmag dpung rengs pa sngon du 'gro bas pha rol po'i dgra'i phyogs nges par bcom nas /
analyzed: rgyal srid ces bya ba ni dmag dpung rengs pa sngon du 'gro bas pha rol po'i dgra'i phyogs nges par bcom nas /
translated: The kingdom is the conquest of the enemy's side by the prior restraint of the army.

original: de las gzhan pa la rgyal srid 'dzin pa'o //ğŸ”½mig sman zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i tshil bu mes bzhu ba las byung ba'i mar chen po la sdong bu bya ba sngon du 'gro bas me sbar la des thod pa'i dum bu'i rgyab kyi du ba blangs la de'i rjes su bdud rtsi lnga'i chus
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la rgyal srid 'dzin pa'o // mig sman zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i tshil bu mes bzhu ba las byung ba'i mar chen po la sdong bu bya ba sngon du 'gro bas me sbar la des thod pa'i dum bu'i rgyab kyi du ba blangs la de'i rjes su bdud rtsi lnga'i chus
translated: Then, holding the kingdom is the holding of the kingdom from others.

original: du ba mnyes la des mig la byug par byas na /
analyzed: du ba mnyes la des mig la byug par byas na /
translated: The eye medicine is the great oil that comes from the fat of one born seven times, which is heated by fire. Having made a wick, one lights it, and with that one takes up the smoke from the back of a piece of skull. After that, one moistens the smoke with the water of the five nectars.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sna tshogs pa mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mig sman gyi dngos grub po //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' sna tshogs pa mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mig sman gyi dngos grub po //
translated: Having anointed the eyes with that, one sees various buddhas and bodhisattvas. This is the power of the eye medicine.

original: bcud kyis len zhes bya ba ni 'di yang le'u bcu drug pa las rang nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcud kyis len zhes bya ba ni 'di yang le'u bcu drug pa las rang nyid kyis 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: The elixir is also explained by the BhagavÄn in chapter sixteen.

original: rkan gyi dbus su lce sbyar ba //
analyzed: rkan gyi dbus su lce sbyar ba //
translated: Having placed the tongue in the middle of the palate,

original: byas nas de kho na'i cho ga bzla //
analyzed: byas nas de kho na'i cho ga bzla //
translated: one should recite the procedure of that.

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung bcas nas ni //
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung bcas nas ni //
translated: And sitting in the bodhisattva posture,

original: yang dag rnal 'byor rjes dran bya //
analyzed: yang dag rnal 'byor rjes dran bya //
translated: One should recollect the perfect yoga.

original: rdzas kyang rtag tu bsten par bya //
analyzed: rdzas kyang rtag tu bsten par bya //
translated: One should always rely on the substance,

original: de nyid lnga yi rim pa bskyed //ğŸ”½bzlas pa rdzogs nas rtag tu ni //
analyzed: de nyid lnga yi rim pa bskyed // bzlas pa rdzogs nas rtag tu ni //
translated: And generate the sequence of the five realities.ğŸ”½Having completed the recitation,

original: lus las byung ba dri ma med //
analyzed: lus las byung ba dri ma med //
translated: One should always use the stainless substance that arises from the body.

original: lcags lnga'i rang bzhin snod du ni //
analyzed: lcags lnga'i rang bzhin snod du ni //
translated: Placing it in a vessel made of the five metals,

original: bzhag nas ji srid nyi ma ni //
analyzed: bzhag nas ji srid nyi ma ni //
translated: For as long as the sun

original: 'char ka de nas de la yang //
analyzed: 'char ka de nas de la yang //
translated: Is rising, then into that

original: btsun mo'i khrag dang bde ba che //
analyzed: btsun mo'i khrag dang bde ba che //
translated: One should pour the blood of a queen and great bliss.

original: blugs nas rtag tu rdzas kyi mchog / bdud rtsi bdun pa'i ming can te //
analyzed: blugs nas rtag tu rdzas kyi mchog / bdud rtsi bdun pa'i ming can te //
translated: Always the supreme substance, called the seven nectars,

original: nyal kar yang ni @63b rdzas de nyid //
analyzed: nyal kar yang ni @63b rdzas de nyid //
translated: At bedtime one should drink that very substance.

original: 'thungs na tshe ni rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: 'thungs na tshe ni rnam par 'phel //
translated: If one drinks it, one's lifespan will increase.

original: sngags kyi rgyal po aom a'a: h'um //
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po aom a'a: h'um //
translated: The king of mantras is Om Ah Hum.

original: de nas lan bdun bzlas pa bya //
analyzed: de nas lan bdun bzlas pa bya //
translated: Then one should recite it seven times.

original: lag g-yas rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan pa //
analyzed: lag g-yas rgyal mtshan gyis mtshan pa //
translated: The right hand marked with a victory banner

original: snod bzang de la bkab nas su //
analyzed: snod bzang de la bkab nas su //
translated: Should cover that excellent vessel.

original: yi ge brgya pa'i sngags kyis ni //
analyzed: yi ge brgya pa'i sngags kyis ni //
translated: With the mantra of the hundred syllables,

original: lan gsum gyis ni dag par bya //
analyzed: lan gsum gyis ni dag par bya //
translated: One should purify it three times.

original: de rjes bud med nu zho ni //
analyzed: de rjes bud med nu zho ni //
translated: Then, the woman's breast

original: rtag tu mkhur ba bkang zhing btung //
analyzed: rtag tu mkhur ba bkang zhing btung //
translated: is always filled with milk and drunk.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmag dpung rangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmag dpung rangs pa'o //
translated: By this and so forth, the army is satisfied.

original: sgrub pa po rang nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs su bsgyur nas gang yang rung ba'i khro bo'i gzugs bzung ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rang nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs su bsgyur nas gang yang rung ba'i khro bo'i gzugs bzung ste /
translated: The practitioner, having transformed into the form of Great Vajradhara, taking on the form of any wrathful one,

original: rang gi 'khor rnams la padma'i khrag bzhin ser skya bsgoms la /
analyzed: rang gi 'khor rnams la padma'i khrag bzhin ser skya bsgoms la /
translated: visualizing his retinue as pale like lotus blood,

original: ri'i rgyal po ltar ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi tshad tsam dmag gi dpung yan lag bzhi pa'i steng du bsgoms na /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ltar ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi tshad tsam dmag gi dpung yan lag bzhi pa'i steng du bsgoms na /
translated: meditating on the four branches of the army of the four divisions of troops, the measure of Mount Meru, the king of mountains,

original: dgra'i dmag gi sde 'og tu zhugs par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa pa le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: dgra'i dmag gi sde 'og tu zhugs par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa pa le'u bcu gsum pa las gsungs so //
translated: seeing the enemy's army enter below, this is taught in the thirteenth chapter of the glorious Guhyasamaja.

original: rtsig pa dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa dbye ba ste /
analyzed: rtsig pa dbye ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa dbye ba ste /
translated: The splitting of walls is the splitting of walls.

original: sngar bshad pa ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las khro bo gang yang rung ba'i cha lugs bzung ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ltar rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa las khro bo gang yang rung ba'i cha lugs bzung ste /
translated: As previously explained, having taken on the attire of any wrathful one from the complete transformation into Great Vajradhara,

original: sngags pas bgegs bskrad pa'i dus su bsgom par byas pas gnod mdzes rgyal po'i bka' bsgo bas khro bo re re las khro bos byin pa'i thal lcag gis dgra bo'i rtsig pa bshig pa ni dgos pa zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
analyzed: sngags pas bgegs bskrad pa'i dus su bsgom par byas pas gnod mdzes rgyal po'i bka' bsgo bas khro bo re re las khro bos byin pa'i thal lcag gis dgra bo'i rtsig pa bshig pa ni dgos pa zhes bya ba ni man ngag go //
translated: The purpose is that when the mantra practitioner meditates on the time of expelling obstructors, by the command of the king of wrathful ones, each of the wrathful ones destroys the wall of enemies with the palm-slap of the wrathful ones. This is the esoteric instruction.

original: rig 'dzin gyi ni go 'phang mchog / ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rig 'dzin gyi ni go 'phang mchog / ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsgoms nas /
translated: The supreme state of a knowledge-holder means that having meditated on the moon maá¹‡á¸ala in the suchness of the element of space,

original: de'i dbus su bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgoms la /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad du bsgoms la /
translated: in the center of that one should meditate on oneself as Vairocana,

original: de'i phyag tu 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bsgoms na rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyag tu 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bsgoms na rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: and if one meditates on the eight-spoked wheel in his hand, one will become a knowledge-holder. This is the siddhi of the concise knowledge-holder.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The supreme is the state of flying in space, and so on.ğŸ”½ The invisible is the state of being invisible.

original: mi snang ba dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i rus pa bdar ba rnams kyi sa tsandan du byas te /
analyzed: mi snang ba dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i rus pa bdar ba rnams kyi sa tsandan du byas te /
translated: Having ground the bones of a seven-times-born being, one should make them into sandalwood.ğŸ”½ Having made a statue of the seven-times-born being, one should recite the mantra.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa la /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur pa la /
translated: The great Vajradhara previously explained

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po gang yang rung ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa la tsandan des lus la bskus te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po gang yang rung ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa la tsandan des lus la bskus te /
translated: is anointed with that sandalwood on the body, which has the form of any of the five Tathagatas.ğŸ”½If one puts the pill previously explained in one's mouth, one becomes invisible.

original: sngar bshad pa'i ri lu khar bcug na mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i dngos grub bo //ğŸ”½gter mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas mig la @64a * //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i ri lu khar bcug na mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i dngos grub bo // gter mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i nga rgyal dang ldan pas mig la @64a * //
translated: This is the power of invisibility.

original: sogs pa'i skye mched rnams la sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsgoms te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i skye mched rnams la sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsgoms te /
translated: Seeing treasure is as follows: As before, one who possesses the pride of Great Vajradhara meditates on the Bodhisattvas such as Kshitigarbha in the eye and other sense bases.ğŸ”½One should meditate on the moon and sun, which are the transformations of the syllables ma and ta.

analyzed: ma yig dang ta yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis bsgom par byas nas 'og na gnas pa'i gter la sogs pa mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gter mthong ba'i dngos grub bo //
translated: One will see the treasure and so forth that is located below. This is the power of seeing treasure.

original: 'dod dgur bsgyur dang zhes bya ba ni sems can de dang de'i rjes su mthun pa bdag nyid lha'i nga rgyal bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod dgur bsgyur dang zhes bya ba ni sems can de dang de'i rjes su mthun pa bdag nyid lha'i nga rgyal bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas bsgom par bya ste /
translated: â€œChanging at willâ€ means that one should meditate on oneself as having the pride of the deity, in accordance with the particular being.

translated: â€œIf one binds it on the arm, etc., one will assume the form of that beingâ€ is the power of the activity of changing at will.

analyzed: rkang mgyogs dang zhes bya ba ni karni ka ra la sogs pa'i sman sbyor gyi stobs kyis grub par bya ste /
translated: â€œFoot-swiftnessâ€ is accomplished by the power of the application of medicines such as kará¹‡ikÄra.

analyzed: ji ltar dpal dus kyi 'khor lor re'u mig gi kha sbyor gsungs pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as it is taught in the glorious KÄlacakra in the section on the union of the two hexagrams.

analyzed: gser 'gyur zhes bya ba ni zangs la sogs pa gser la sogs par byed pa'i gser 'gyur gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: â€œTransmutationâ€ is the characteristic of the transmutation of copper, etc., into gold, etc.

original: dug las rgyal zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bya khyung bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: dug las rgyal zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bya khyung bsgom pa'am /
translated: â€œVictory over poisonâ€ is the meditation on the garuá¸a.

analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub dang / gnod mdzes bsgoms pas brtan pa dang / g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can gyi dug 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: By meditating on Aparajita and Sumbharaja, one conquers poison, both that which is inherent and that which is created by spells.

analyzed: me yi nang du 'jug pa dag / zhes bya ba ni me la de bzhin gshegs pa snang ba mtha' yas bsgom pa la sogs pas de'i nang du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Entering into fire means entering into fire by meditating on Amitabha Buddha in the fire, and so on.

analyzed: dbang po re res yul thams cad la longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid can no // ye shes lnga ni thob par 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me long la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The line one attains the five intuitions refers to the mirror intuition and so on.

original: zab mo ma yin pa dang zab mo'i bskyed pa'i rim pa sngon du 'gro bas me long la sogs pa'i ye shes grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo ma yin pa dang zab mo'i bskyed pa'i rim pa sngon du 'gro bas me long la sogs pa'i ye shes grub pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di rnams kyi chen po nyid kyang yon tan mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: me long ye shes ngar 'dzin med //

original: yongs su ma chad rnyog pa med //
analyzed: yongs su ma chad rnyog pa med //

original: shes bya kun la ma rmongs pa //
analyzed: shes bya kun la ma rmongs pa //

analyzed: de @64b rnams la yang mngon phyogs min //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: de ltar gnas skabs kyi 'bras bub rjod par bstan nas /

analyzed: byang chub ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa zung du 'jug pas bsdus pa skad cig la byang chub pa'o //

analyzed: go 'phang ni rten gyi gnas so //

analyzed: dka' thub spyod pa spangs nas ni //

analyzed: de rnams spangs pa ni de rnams dang bral ba'o //

original: shes rab snying rje yang dag ldan //
analyzed: shes rab snying rje yang dag ldan //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnams la'o //

analyzed: shes rab kyang yin la snying rje yang yin pas na shes rab snying rje'o //

analyzed: des mi dgos zhes bya ba ni smyung ba dang sdom pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: â€œIt is not necessary to fastâ€ means that it is not necessary to fast, to observe vows, and so on.

analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi sgo nas sems 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: lte ba'i nam mkha' las byung ba'i rlung la 'khor lo de dang de'i dbye bas rim pa mtshon pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gnyis med ye shes zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba thams cad nub pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
